outrun.title: Out Run

sources.description: Sega Out Run Operator's Manual - steering mechanism specifies 270 degree range

outrun.notes: Uses mechanical stops at 135 degrees each direction from center. Sega Super Scaler hardware.

polepos.title: Pole Position

sources.description: Namco/Atari Pole Position uses optical encoder wheel with infinite rotation capability

polepos.notes: Infinite rotation optical encoder (spinner). Maps better to spinner/mouse input than modern wheel.

harddriv.title: Hard Drivin'

sources.description: Atari Hard Drivin' uses potentiometer-based steering with calibration-dependent range. 270 is commonly cited default.

harddriv.notes: Potentiometer-based, calibration-dependent. Actual effective range may vary by cabinet condition.

daytona.title: Daytona USA

sources.description: Standard Sega Model 2 racing cabinet steering specification

daytona.notes: Sega Model 2 hardware. Common Sega 270 degree spec.

ridgerac.title: Ridge Racer

sources.description: Namco System 22 standard steering specification

ridgerac.notes: Namco System 22 hardware. Standard Namco 270 degree wheel.

crusnusa.title: Cruis'n USA

sources.description: Standard Midway racing cabinet steering specification

crusnusa.notes: Midway hardware. Standard 270 degree arcade wheel.

vr.title: Virtua Racing

sources.description: Sega Model 1 cabinet specifications - 270 degree steering wheel

vr.notes: Sega Model 1 hardware. First Sega 3D polygon racing game.

sources.description: Sega Model 2 cabinet specifications - 270 degree steering wheel

fzeroax.title: F-Zero AX

sources.description: Arcade-Projects forum - F-Zero AX wheel estimated at ~150 degrees, less than half a turn

fzeroax.notes: Triforce hardware. Community reports ~150 degrees - significantly less than standard 270. Less than half a turn suits the high-speed F-Zero gameplay.

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

battle_gear_4.title: Battle Gear 4

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

battle_gear_4.notes: Taito Type X+ hardware. 540 degrees - wider range than typical arcade racers.

battle_gear_4_tuned.title: Battle Gear 4 Tuned

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

battle_gear_4_tuned.notes: Taito Type X+ hardware. Updated version of Battle Gear 4.

initial_d_4.title: Initial D: Arcade Stage 4

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

initial_d_4.notes: Sega Lindbergh Yellow hardware. Initial D stages 4-8 use 540 degree rotation.

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

initial_d_6.title: Initial D: Arcade Stage 6 Double Ace

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

initial_d_7.title: Initial D: Arcade Stage 7 Double Ace Cross

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

initial_d_zero.title: Initial D: Arcade Stage Zero

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

initial_d_zero.notes: Sega Nu hardware. Series switched from 540 to 270 starting with this entry.

sources.description: TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field
TeknoParrot Metadata - wheel_rotation field

hummer.title: Hummer

sources.description: Sega Lindbergh standard driving cabinet with 5K potentiometer

hummer.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Standard Sega 270-degree wheel with force feedback.

hummer_extreme.title: Hummer Extreme Edition

sources.description: Same cabinet/hardware as Hummer with updated content

hummer_extreme.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Identical steering assembly to Hummer.

r_tuned.title: R-Tuned: Ultimate Street Racing

sources.description: Uses modified SEGA Race TV cabinet with standard Lindbergh steering

r_tuned.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Modified SEGA Race TV cabinet. TeknoParrot also available as R-TunedElf2.

sega_race_tv.title: SEGA Race TV

sources.description: Standard Sega Lindbergh racing cabinet

sega_race_tv.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. R-Tuned uses a modified version of this cabinet. TeknoParrot also available as segartvelf2.

sources.description: Sega Lindbergh standard driving cabinet. Service manual shows standard 8-bit pot steering calibration.

grid_arcade.title: GRID

sources.description: Reuses SEGA Racing Classic cabinet design

grid_arcade.notes: Sega Europa-R hardware. Codemasters game in Sega Racing Classic cabinet.

daytona_championship.title: Daytona Championship USA

sources.description: Standard Sega racing cabinet. Community setup guides reference 270 degrees.

daytona_championship.notes: Sega PC hardware. Spiritual successor to Daytona USA. NSE (Daytona3NSE) is the Network Satellite Edition of the same game.

showdown.title: Showdown

sources.description: Same Sega standard racing cabinet as GRID

showdown.notes: Sega PC hardware. DiRT: Showdown arcade port.

sources.description: Cabinet based on SEGA Racing Classic, uses R-Tuned steering wheel

lets_go_safari.title: Let's Go Safari

sources.description: Sega RingWide kiddie driving game. Uses arcade steering wheel controls.

lets_go_safari.notes: Sega RingWide hardware. Kiddie edutainment driving game.

sega_racing_classic.title: SEGA Racing Classic

sources.description: HD remaster of Daytona USA. Standard Sega racing cabinet.

sega_racing_classic.notes: Sega RingWide hardware. HD remaster of Daytona USA.

sources.description: Uses SEGA Racing Classic cabinet design with cosmetic modifications

harley_davidson.title: Harley-Davidson: King of the Road

sources.description: Motorcycle handlebar controls with 5K potentiometer. Estimated ~90 degrees based on physical handlebar range.

harley_davidson.notes: Sega Lindbergh hardware. Motorcycle handlebars, NOT a steering wheel. Rotation is much less than car games.

fzeroax_monster.title: F-Zero AX Monster Ride

sources.description: Community estimates ~150 degrees. Cabinet variant but same steering input range.

fzeroax_monster.notes: Triforce hardware. Monster Ride cabinet variant. Same ~150 degree range as standard F-Zero AX.

mario_kart_gp.title: Mario Kart Arcade GP

sources.description: Namco-manufactured cabinet on Triforce hardware. Standard Namco 270-degree steering.

mario_kart_gp.notes: Sega Triforce hardware. Namco cabinet design.

mario_kart_gp2.title: Mario Kart Arcade GP 2

sources.description: Same Namco cabinet and steering hardware as MKAGP1

mario_kart_gp2.notes: Sega Triforce hardware. Same cabinet as Mario Kart GP.

sources.description: Namco ES1 standard racing cabinet with force-feedback steering assembly

maximum_heat_3d.title: Maximum Heat 3D

sources.description: Japanese 3D version of Dead Heat. Identical steering assembly.

maximum_heat_3d.notes: Namco ES1 hardware. Stereoscopic 3D version of Dead Heat.

nirin.title: Nirin

sources.description: Motorcycle game using handlebars, not steering wheel. Estimated ~60 degrees.

nirin.notes: Namco ES1 hardware. Motorcycle swivel controller with handlebars. Steering is primarily lean-based.

tank_tank_tank.title: Tank! Tank! Tank!

sources.description: Namco ES1 cabinet. Manual documents stopper arm/shaft confirming mechanical stops.

tank_tank_tank.notes: Namco ES1 hardware. Tank combat game with steering.

mario_kart_gp_dx.title: Mario Kart Arcade GP DX

sources.description: SuzoHapp parts listing: '270 active steering wheel assembly' (part 50-0102-50EX)

mario_kart_gp_dx.notes: Namco ES3A hardware. TeknoParrot variants: MKDX, MKDX118, MKDXUSA, MKDXUSA106.

dead_heat_riders.title: Dead Heat Riders

sources.description: Motorcycle game using force feedback swivel bike seat with handlebars. Estimated ~60 degrees.

dead_heat_riders.notes: Namco hardware. Motorcycle handlebars, NOT a steering wheel.

wmmt3dxp.title: Wangan Midnight Maximum Tune 3DX Plus

sources.description: Same steering hardware as WMMT3 through WMMT6RR series - all confirmed 270 degrees

wmmt3dxp.notes: Namco N2 hardware. Variant of WMMT3.

sources.description: Namco System 246 standard racing cabinet. 270 degrees consistent with Namco standard.

battle_gear_3.title: Battle Gear 3

sources.description: Same series as Battle Gear 4 (confirmed 540). Force feedback servo motor.

battle_gear_3.notes: Namco System 246 hardware. Taito-developed. Same Battle Gear series as BG4 (540 degrees).

battle_gear_3_tuned.title: Battle Gear 3 Tuned

sources.description: Updated version of Battle Gear 3. Same steering hardware.

battle_gear_3_tuned.notes: Namco System 246 hardware. Updated version of Battle Gear 3.

motogp_namco.title: MotoGP

sources.description: Motorcycle racing with handlebars. Estimated ~60 degrees.

motogp_namco.notes: Namco System 246 hardware. Motorcycle handlebars, NOT a steering wheel.

wangan_midnight.title: Wangan Midnight

sources.description: First Wangan Midnight game. Same cabinet lineage as WMMT series (all confirmed 270).

wangan_midnight.notes: Namco System 246 hardware. Predecessor to WMMT series.

sources.description: Upgraded version of Wangan Midnight. Same cabinet and 270-degree steering.
SuzoHapp Active 270 steering assembly. Parts catalog confirms 270-degree active steering for Raw Thrills games.

fnf_drift.title: The Fast and the Furious Drift

sources.description: Same Raw Thrills platform with SuzoHapp Active 270 steering

fnf_superbikes.title: The Fast and the Furious Super Bikes

sources.description: Motorcycle cabinet with swivel bike controller and handlebars. Limited handlebar rotation.

fnf_superbikes.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Motorcycle handlebars with lean-based steering.

fnf_supercars.title: The Fast and the Furious SuperCars

sources.description: SuzoHapp parts catalog confirms shared steering wheel hoop with Raw Thrills car games

super_bikes_2.title: Super Bikes 2

sources.description: Same swivel motorcycle controller platform as FNF Super Bikes

super_bikes_2.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Motorcycle handlebars with lean-based steering.

super_bikes_3.title: Super Bikes 3

sources.description: Same swivel motorcycle controller platform

super_bikes_3.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Motorcycle handlebars with lean-based steering.

batman_raw_thrills.title: Batman

sources.description: Custom Bat Wheel but same Raw Thrills 270-degree platform

batman_raw_thrills.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Custom 'Bat Wheel' design on standard Raw Thrills steering assembly.

cars_pixar.title: Cars

sources.description: SuzoHapp explicitly lists Pixar Cars as using shared Raw Thrills steering wheel hoop

cars_pixar.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Disney Pixar Cars arcade racer.

sources.description: SuzoHapp explicitly lists Dirty Drivin' as using shared Raw Thrills steering wheel hoop

h2overdrive.title: H2Overdrive

sources.description: SuzoHapp explicitly lists H2Overdrive as using shared Raw Thrills steering wheel hoop

h2overdrive.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Boat racing but uses standard steering wheel.

sources.description: Raw Thrills standard platform. Same Dell PC-based hardware as other Raw Thrills car games.

snocross.title: Winter X Games SnoCross

sources.description: Swivel snowmobile handle controller seat with handlebar-style controls

snocross.notes: Raw Thrills PC hardware. Snowmobile handlebars with motion seat. Lean-based steering.

crusnblast.title: Cruis'n Blast

sources.description: SuzoHapp lists Cruis'n Blast as using shared Raw Thrills steering wheel hoop. Active 270 timing belt.

crusnblast.notes: Raw Thrills Linux PC hardware. Latest in Cruis'n series.

motogp_raw_thrills.title: MotoGP

sources.description: Authentic MotoGP replica motorcycle swivel controller with handlebars

motogp_raw_thrills.notes: Raw Thrills Linux PC hardware. Motorcycle handlebars with lean-based steering.

arctic_thunder.title: Arctic Thunder

sources.description: SuzoHapp Active 270 timing belt compatible. Handlebar form factor but uses same 270-degree steering assembly.

arctic_thunder.notes: Midway PC hardware. Snowmobile-style handlebars but with Active 270 steering mechanism.

sources.description: SuzoHapp Active 270 timing belt compatible. Standard steering wheel.

ultimate_arctic_thunder.title: Ultimate Arctic Thunder

sources.description: Updated Arctic Thunder on Midway Graphite hardware. Same handlebar controller.

ultimate_arctic_thunder.notes: Midway Graphite hardware. Updated Arctic Thunder.

sources.description: Gaelco custom hardware. 270 degrees assumed from industry standard.

ring_riders.title: Ring Riders

sources.description: Motorcycle cabinet with handlebars. Manual documents stopper parts limiting rotation.

ring_riders.notes: Gaelco PC hardware. Motorcycle handlebars with motion platform.

tokyo_cop.title: Tokyo Cop

sources.description: Shares motor controller board with Championship Tuning Race. 270 assumed.

tokyo_cop.notes: Gaelco PC hardware. Car chase game.

sources.description: Italian scooter racing with handlebar controls. Limited rotation range.
Direct sequel to Chase H.Q. (confirmed 270 degrees). Taito standard racing cabinet.

d1gp_arcade.title: D1GP Arcade

sources.description: Drift racing game. No official specs found. Taito standard 270-degree steering.

d1gp_arcade.notes: Taito Type X2 hardware. Drift racing.

sources.description: Battle Gear successor/spinoff. Taito standard steering with force feedback.
Uses force feedback steering wheel with SuzoHapp steering mechanism
Standard arcade racing cabinet with steering wheel motor assembly
GTI Club series from Konami. Standard 270-degree arcade wheel.

ballistics.title: Ballistics

sources.description: SuzoHapp 270-degree wheel explicitly listed as compatible with Triotech Ballistics

ballistics.notes: Triotech PC hardware. Futuristic tube racer with motion seat.

sources.description: Same Triotech Mad Wave Motion platform as Ballistics. Same steering assembly.
RC car racing. Uses HAPP UCGI Driving board. 270 assumed from standard components.
Standard arcade racer. 270 assumed from industry standard.
Standard arcade racer. 270 assumed from industry standard.

frenzy_express.title: Frenzy Express

sources.description: Kick scooter controller with handlebars. Very limited handlebar rotation.

frenzy_express.notes: Uniana PC hardware. Kick scooter with handlebars.

sources.description: Chinese arcade manufacturer. Standard steering wheel. 270 assumed.
Chinese arcade manufacturer. Standard steering wheel. 270 assumed.

18wheeler.title: 18 Wheeler: American Pro Trucker

sources.description: Arcade-Projects and Racketboy forum discussions confirming 360-degree wheel

18wheeler.notes: NAOMI hardware. Multiple forum sources confirm 360 degrees, notably more than the typical Sega 270. Complex mechanical stops with set screws.

abcop.title: A.B. Cop

sources.description: Web research - no specific rotation data found for handlebar controls

abcop.notes: Motorcycle/air-bike on Sega X Board. Uses handlebar controls. No specific rotation degrees found. Likely 45-90 degree range typical of handlebar controls.

crazytaxi.title: Crazy Taxi

sources.description: Arcade Museum forum - Crazy Taxi steering confirmed 270 degrees

crazytaxi.notes: NAOMI hardware. Confirmed 270 degrees by multiple sources. No force feedback; uses spring-based centering.

daytonausa2pe.title: Daytona USA 2 Power Edition

sources.description: Supermodel emulator community confirms 270-degree 1:1 ratio with arcade

daytonausa2pe.notes: Model 3 Step 2.1. Uses 5k ohm potentiometer. Supermodel emulator confirms 270 degrees gives 1:1 ratio. Shares SPG-2002 steering assembly with Scud Race, Sega Rally 2, Dirt Devils. 500W servo motor FFB.

daytonausa2.title: Daytona USA 2

sources.description: Same cabinet as Power Edition - Supermodel community confirms 270 degrees

daytonausa2.notes: Model 3 Step 2.1. Same hardware/cabinet as Power Edition (ROM update). 270-degree potentiometer with 500W servo FFB.

dirtdevils.title: Dirt Devils

sources.description: Sega Dirt Devils Owner's Manual

dirtdevils.notes: Model 3. Shares SPG-2002 steering assembly with Daytona USA 2, Scud Race, Sega Rally 2. 500W servo motor FFB.

gprider.title: GP Rider

sources.description: Web research - no specific rotation data found

gprider.notes: Motorcycle on Sega X Board. Twin ride-on cabinet with tilting replica motorcycles. No specific handlebar rotation found.

hangonjr.title: Hang-On Jr.

sources.description: Web research - no specific rotation data found

hangonjr.notes: Cut-down Hang-On on Sega System E. Uses handlebar controls with potentiometer. No specific rotation degrees found.

harleydavidson.title: Harley-Davidson and L.A. Riders

sources.description: Web research - no specific rotation data found

harleydavidson.notes: Motorcycle on Model 3 Step 2.0. Handlebar controls with gear shift on left handlebar. Manual describes calibration but no specific degrees found.

jambosafari.title: Jambo! Safari

sources.description: Arcade-Projects confirms Jambo Safari works in Crazy Taxi cabinet at 270 degrees

jambosafari.notes: NAOMI hardware. Works in Crazy Taxi cabinet (also 270). Spring-based centering, no FFB. Part of Sega 'Real Life Career Series'.

lemans24.title: Le Mans 24

sources.description: Supermodel emulator community confirms 270 degrees

lemans24.notes: Model 3 Step 1.5. Uses older steering motor/FFB boards (same as Touring Cars). Supermodel emulator recommends 270 degrees for 1:1 arcade feel.

manxttsuperbike.title: Manx TT Superbike

sources.description: Web research - approximate range inferred from emulation community

manxttsuperbike.notes: Motorcycle on Model 2A. Honda RC45 replica. Tilts left/right plus handlebar input. Emulation suggests 180 degrees on wheel feels natural but freer than real cabinet. Likely 45-90 degree range.

motorraid.title: Motor Raid

sources.description: Same hardware as Manx TT Superbike

motorraid.notes: Motorcycle combat racing on Model 2A. ROM swap for Manx TT Superbike - uses identical cabinet/handlebar hardware. Additional attack buttons.

outrunners.title: OutRunners

sources.description: Racketboy forum lists OutRunners alongside OutRun at 270 degrees

outrunners.notes: Sega System Multi 32. Third OutRun installment. Original OutRun confirmed at 270 degrees. Similar cabinet design lineage. Steering wheel with vibration effects.

powerdrift.title: Power Drift

sources.description: Community consensus on 270-degree Sega Super Scaler convention

powerdrift.notes: Sega Y Board (Super Scaler). Go-kart racing by Yu Suzuki. Deluxe cab has hydraulics. Uses gear/cog steering system with FFB.

stadiumcross.title: Stadium Cross

sources.description: Web research - no specific rotation data found

stadiumcross.notes: Motocross on Sega System Multi 32. Twin cabinet using two System 32 boards. Motorcycle handlebar controls. No specific rotation found.

scudrace.title: Scud Race

sources.description: 8Bitplus Scud Race restoration confirms potentiometer steering
Supermodel emulator community confirms 270 degrees

scudrace.notes: First Model 3 racer (Step 1.5). Also known as Sega Super GT in North America. Shares SPG-2002 steering assembly with Daytona 2, Sega Rally 2, Dirt Devils. Motor-driven FFB (no spring centering).

segarally2.title: Sega Rally 2

sources.description: Supermodel emulator and Thrustmaster setup guide confirm 270 degrees

segarally2.notes: Model 3 Step 2.1. 500W servo motor FFB. Shares SPG-2002 assembly with Daytona 2, Scud Race, Dirt Devils. Handbrake for hairpin turns. 5k ohm pot steering.

emergencycallambulance.title: Emergency Call Ambulance

sources.description: Sega Emergency Call Ambulance Manual - Model 3 steering assembly

emergencycallambulance.notes: Model 3 hardware (NOT NAOMI). Shares SPG-2002 steering with other Model 3 racers. Dedicated ambulance-themed sit-down cabinet with flashing lights.

aquajet.title: Aqua Jet

sources.description: Arcade-Projects Aqua Jet controls discussion

aquajet.notes: Super System 22. Jet ski game where player leans to steer on waterscooter platform. Not a traditional wheel/handlebar game. Body-lean tilt-based steering.

battlegear.title: Battle Gear

sources.description: Arcade-Projects Battle Gear conversion thread

battlegear.notes: Taito JC System. Successor to Side by Side series. FFB via Matsushita/Panasonic servo motor board similar to Sega Model 2/3 games.

changelanes.title: Change Lanes

sources.description: Change Lanes service manual from Internet Archive confirms optical encoder

changelanes.notes: Service manual confirms optical encoder (spinner) steering. Uses optocoupler with interrupter wheel (slotted disc). Infinite rotation, no mechanical stops.

chequeredflag.title: Chequered Flag

sources.description: Inferred from Konami racing game convention and limited-range description

chequeredflag.notes: Konami GX717 hardware. Limited-range steering wheel with analog gas and digital brake. 270 degrees based on Konami racing convention. Could be less (180-240).

continentalcircus.title: Continental Circus

sources.description: MAME source taito_z.cpp reveals dual input modes via DIP switch

continentalcircus.notes: Taito Z System. DIP switch selectable between paddle (potentiometer, locked steering) and dial (encoder, free-spinning) modes. Sit-down uses locked 270-degree pot mode.

counterrun.title: Counter Run

sources.description: MAME input type confirmed as dial (optical encoder)

counterrun.notes: NOT a racing game - maze/fruit-collecting game controlling a car through mazes. Uses dial (rotary encoder) with infinite rotation. Borderline for wheel database.

doubleaxle.title: Double Axle

sources.description: Arcade-Projects discusses potentiometer steering for conversions

doubleaxle.notes: Taito Z System monster truck racing. Potentiometer or encoder depending on cabinet variant. 270 degrees based on Taito racing convention.

dirtdash.title: Dirt Dash

sources.description: Namco 1K 270-degree potentiometer (VG75-07050-00)
Dirt Dash steering motor listing

dirtdash.notes: Namco System 22. FFB via DTM 5230J / Unitec motor. Uses standard Namco 1K 270-degree potentiometer (part VG75-07050-00).

dirtfox.title: Dirt Fox

sources.description: Namco System 2 potentiometer standard (confirmed via Final Lap 3 manual)

dirtfox.notes: Namco System 2. Off-road racing, Japan-only. Same platform as Final Lap series. 270 degrees based on Namco standard potentiometer.

driverseyes.title: Driver's Eyes

sources.description: Namco System 21 platform convention

driverseyes.notes: Namco System 21. First Namco triple-monitor panoramic game. Extremely rare. 270 degrees based on System 21 convention shared with Winning Run.

f1gpstar2.title: F-1 Grand Prix Star II

sources.description: Era-standard assumption - no specific documentation found

f1gpstar2.notes: Jaleco custom hardware. F1 racing. Very little documentation for Jaleco racing cabinets. 270 degrees assumed based on early 1990s convention.

finallap3.title: Final Lap 3

sources.description: Final Lap 3 Operator's Manual confirms potentiometer steering

finallap3.notes: Namco System 2. F1 racing, up to 8 players linked. Operator manual confirms potentiometer steering (center wipe on pin A21, 0-5V range).

fourtrax.title: Four Trax

sources.description: Namco System 2 potentiometer standard

fourtrax.notes: Namco System 2. ATV off-road racing, Japan-only, up to 4 linked. Uses standard steering wheel (not handlebars despite being quad bikes).

jetwave.title: Jet Wave

sources.description: Web research - extremely rare, no specific data found

jetwave.notes: Known as Wave Shark in North America. Jet ski replica cabinet with handlebar controls. Extremely rare (2 known units). Handlebar range likely 45-60 degrees.

overrev.title: Over Rev

sources.description: Arcade-Projects confirms Model 2 standard potentiometer compatibility

overrev.notes: Runs on Sega Model 2C hardware. Uses same cabinet/steering as other Model 2 racers (Daytona USA, Sega Rally). Standard 5K potentiometer.

pocketracer.title: Pocket Racer

sources.description: Namco convention for System 11 cabinet controls

pocketracer.notes: Namco System 11 (PlayStation-based). Choro-Q spin-off of Ridge Racer. Japan-exclusive. Very rare (2 known units). Standard Namco cabinet controls.

supergt24h.title: Super GT 24h

sources.description: Arcade-Projects - Super GT 24h potentiometer compatibility

supergt24h.notes: Runs on Sega Model 2B hardware. Test menu shows steering centered at 80H. Compatible with standard Sega 5K potentiometers.

sidebyside2.title: Side by Side 2

sources.description: Taito racing convention and Battle Gear series continuity

sidebyside2.notes: Taito JC System. Japanese touge racing, precursor to Battle Gear series (confirmed at 270). Consistent with Taito racing convention.

technodrive.title: Techno Drive

sources.description: Namco standard potentiometer convention

technodrive.notes: Namco System 12 (PlayStation-based). Driving minigame collection. Standard Namco cabinet controls with 270-degree potentiometer.

tokyowars.title: Tokyo Wars

sources.description: Namco System 22 platform standard

tokyowars.notes: Super System 22. TANK combat, not racing. Steering wheel controls turret aiming with fire buttons. Same 270-degree Namco potentiometer as Ridge Racer/System 22 games.

winningrun.title: Winning Run

sources.description: Namco System 21 platform standard

winningrun.notes: First Namco System 21 game. F1 simulator with hydraulic motion cabinet. First polygon-based racing game with shaded 3D.

winningrunsuzuka.title: Winning Run Suzuka Grand Prix

sources.description: Namco System 21 platform standard

winningrunsuzuka.notes: Namco System 21. Sequel to Winning Run. Sit-down cabinet similar to Final Lap series. Same System 21 steering mechanism.

californiaspeed.title: California Speed

sources.description: SuzoHapp 270-degree wheel assembly for Atari racers

californiaspeed.notes: Atari Seattle hardware. Shares cabinet with SF Rush series. SuzoHapp 270-degree steering assembly confirmed via parts catalog.

dragrace.title: Drag Race

sources.description: Sprint II cabinet reuse with optical encoder assemblies

dragrace.notes: Reuses Sprint II cabinet design with optical encoder steering. Minimal steering gameplay effect - mainly keeping car in lane.

driversedge.title: Driver's Edge

sources.description: Era-standard assumption - very rare game

driversedge.notes: Very rare F1 racing game (~8 known units). 270 degrees assumed based on era standard. Incredible Technologies primarily known for Golden Tee.

driftout.title: Drift Out

sources.description: MAME input type confirmed as dial (optical encoder)

driftout.notes: Top-down rally racing on Taito F2 hardware. MAME lists as dial (optical encoder/spinner). Screen rotates around player car. Can also be played with joystick.

harddrivinsairborne.title: Hard Drivin's Airborne

sources.description: Hard Drivin' series service manual - 10-turn potentiometer with 3 rotation stop

harddrivinsairborne.notes: Unreleased prototype in Hard Drivin' series. Uses same 10-turn potentiometer with ~3 rotations (~1080 degrees). Service manual references '3 rotation stop'.

nightdriver.title: Night Driver

sources.description: Wikipedia paddle controller article - confirms potentiometer-based steering

nightdriver.notes: One of earliest first-person racing games. Wikipedia confirms paddle wheel mechanically coupled to potentiometer. 4-position gear shift and accelerator pedal.

offroadchallenge.title: Off Road Challenge

sources.description: Same cabinet/wheel assembly as Cruis'n World and SF Rush

offroadchallenge.notes: Same cabinet as Cruis'n World and SF Rush. Motorized FFB steering. Midway V-Unit hardware. SuzoHapp 270-degree wheel.

roadburners.title: Road Burners

sources.description: Standard motorcycle arcade cabinet handlebar range

roadburners.notes: Motorcycle racing with tilting motorcycle cabinet. Handlebar rotation ~45 degrees total, combined with lean input. Up to 8 players linkable.

roadsedge.title: Roads Edge

sources.description: Manual auto-center description indicates pot-based 270-degree system

roadsedge.notes: First racer on Hyper Neo Geo 64. Custom Driving Board with analog steering. Auto-centers during boot (potentiometer-based). Up to 4 linkable.

sfrush2049se.title: San Francisco Rush 2049 Special Edition

sources.description: SuzoHapp parts catalog for Rush 2049 cabinets

sfrush2049se.notes: Software upgrade to Rush 2049 cabinets. SuzoHapp 270-degree FFB wheel. Sit-down with 4-speed shifter and 3 pedals.

slipstream.title: Slip Stream

sources.description: Sega System 32 platform standard

slipstream.notes: Extremely rare F1 game (~150 units) on Sega System 32. Only non-Sega game on this hardware. 270 based on System 32 platform standard.

spyhunter2.title: Spy Hunter II

sources.description: Era-standard assumption for 1980s driving games

spyhunter2.notes: Shared cabinet with Max RPM. Two-player split screen with two wheels, pedals, shifters, weapon buttons. 270 estimated from era standard.

superspeedracejr.title: Super Speed Race Junior

sources.description: MAME dial input type and Speed Race series optical encoder lineage

superspeedracejr.notes: Final game in Taito's Speed Race series (since 1974). MAME lists as dial (optical encoder). Top-down perspective.

streetdrivin.title: Street Drivin'

sources.description: Hard Drivin' series hardware - 10-turn potentiometer

streetdrivin.notes: Unreleased prototype, Race Drivin' sequel. Same Hard Drivin' cabinet with 10-turn potentiometer and ~3 rotation stop.

topsecret.title: Top Secret

sources.description: Standard pot-based range assumption

topsecret.notes: Spy driving/shooting on Exidy 440. Conversion kit for Crossbow cabinets with add-on steering wheel. Custom interface board for steering.

worldrally.title: World Rally

sources.description: Arcade Museum forum - PCB jumper for 270/360 degree wheel selection documented

worldrally.notes: PCB jumper selects between 270-degree potentiometer and 360-degree optical wheel. Standard config is 270-degree pot. 23,000 units sold in Europe.

xtremeally.title: Xtreme Rally

sources.description: Manual auto-center/calibration description plus Roads Edge platform continuity

xtremeally.notes: Hyper Neo Geo 64. Sequel to Roads Edge. FFB auto-centers during boot. Manual warns not to touch steering during Network Check (self-calibration). Up to 4 linkable.

acedriver.title: Ace Driver

sources.description: Namco System 22 calibration thread on BYOAC

acedriver.notes: Namco System 22. Continuous rotation potentiometer, no spring return. 10-inch red leather racing wheel. FFB motor. Same platform as Ridge Racer.

raveracer.title: Rave Racer

sources.description: Namco System 22 platform standard - same as Ridge Racer

raveracer.notes: Third Ridge Racer entry, Namco System 22. Adds FFB over Ridge Racer 2. Same platform and steering as Ridge Racer and Ace Driver.

steeringchamp.title: Steering Champ

sources.description: Era-standard assumption for steering wheel arcade games

steeringchamp.notes: Part of Bishi Bashi series (Handle Champ in Japan). Collection of 17 car-themed minigames. Konami 573 hardware. Not a traditional racing game.

longbeach.title: Long Beach

sources.description: No documentation found - extremely obscure

longbeach.notes: Extremely rare Italian-made top-down driving game. No known surviving units. Zero documentation found.

wheelsandfire.title: Wheels & Fire

sources.description: Conflicting control information - may not use steering wheel

wheelsandfire.notes: Obscure Spanish-made racing game. arcade-history.com lists joystick control despite MAME paddle classification. May use joystick not wheel.
